what_is_this: toolpilled — a curated registry of the current best tool for 26 common dev tasks. Stop defaulting to whatever has the most Stack Overflow answers. Each entry has install commands, env vars, and code that actually runs.
how_to_use: Find your task by id or keywords. Use the 'best' recommendation. Each entry has working code you can execute directly. All pricing verified from official sources.

tasks.task: Convert audio or video file to text

best.why: 216x real-time speed (1 hour of audio in ~17 seconds). $0.04/hr — 9x cheaper than OpenAI, 11x cheaper than Deepgram. Free tier: ~8 hrs/day of audio. Multilingual (99+ languages).

code.python:
from groq import Groq

client = Groq()

with open("audio.mp3", "rb") as f:
    result = client.audio.transcriptions.create(
        model="whisper-large-v3-turbo",
        file=f,
        response_format="verbose_json"
    )

print(result.text)

best.pricing: $0.04/hr (v3-turbo), $0.02/hr (distil-whisper, English only), $0.111/hr (v3 full). Batch API: 50% off.
best.free_tier: 28,800 audio-seconds/day (~8 hrs). No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Most widely documented. GPT-4o Mini Transcribe is a good budget option at $0.18/hr.
alternatives.free_tier: $5 credit for new accounts (expires in 3 months)

alternatives.why: Real-time streaming support. $200 in free credits (no expiry) — most generous trial. $0.0077/min pay-as-you-go.
alternatives.free_tier: $200 free credits (~433 hours), no credit card required

alternatives.why: Lowest non-Groq base rate at $0.15/hr. Add-ons for diarization, sentiment, PII redaction. $50 free credits.

tasks.warning: Do NOT use local openai/whisper pip package for production. It processes audio at roughly 1:1 real-time speed on CPU. Always use a cloud API.

tasks.task: Send transactional or marketing emails from your application

best.why: Agent-friendly API: clean REST endpoints, structured docs with code examples agents can directly parse. Simple setup, modern DX. Best free tier among modern email APIs.

code.python:
import resend resend.api_key = "re_xxxxx" r = resend.Emails.send({ "from": "you@yourdomain.com", "to": "user@example.com", "subject": "Hello", "html": "

Hello world

" }) print(r)
code.curl:
curl -X POST 'https://api.resend.com/emails' \ -H 'Authorization: Bearer re_xxxxx' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -d '{"from":"you@yourdomain.com","to":"user@example.com","subject":"Hello","html":"

Hello world

"}'

best.pricing: Free: 3,000 emails/month, 100/day, 1 domain. Pro: $20/mo (50K emails). Scale: $90/mo (100K emails). Overage: $0.90/1K emails.
best.free_tier: 3,000 emails/month, 100/day. 1 domain. 1-day data retention.

alternatives.why: Best deliverability reputation. $15/mo for 10K emails. Free tier: 100 emails/month (very small).
High-volume plans. Free tier retired May 2025 — now starts at Essentials: $19.95/mo for 50K. Docs are complex and hard for agents to parse.

tasks.task: Receive and process incoming emails in your application via webhook

best.why: Simple webhook-based inbound email. Configure MX records, set a webhook URL, Resend forwards incoming emails as structured JSON. Same account as send-email.

setup.requires: 1. Domain with MX records pointing to Resend. 2. A webhook endpoint URL.

best.pricing: Included in Resend plans

alternatives.why: More mature, supports complex routing rules and filters

tasks.task: Set up a relational database for a web application

best.why: Full Postgres database with auto-generated REST API, built-in auth (50K MAUs free), and file storage. Excellent structured documentation that agents can parse easily. Most frequently chosen by AI agents.

code.python:
from supabase import create_client
import os

supabase = create_client(os.environ['SUPABASE_URL'], os.environ['SUPABASE_ANON_KEY'])

# Insert
supabase.table('users').insert({'name': 'Alice', 'email': 'alice@example.com'}).execute()

# Query
result = supabase.table('users').select('*').eq('name', 'Alice').execute()
print(result.data)

best.pricing: Free: 500MB database, 1GB storage, 5GB bandwidth, 50K auth MAUs, 2 projects (pauses after 7 days idle). Pro: $25/mo (8GB DB, 100GB storage, 250GB bandwidth). Overage: $0.125/GB storage, $0.09/GB bandwidth.
best.free_tier: 500MB database, 2 active projects. Projects pause after 1 week of inactivity.

alternatives.why: Serverless Postgres that scales to zero. Acquired by Databricks (May 2025), still operational. Free: 0.5GB/project, 100 compute-hours/mo, 100 projects. Storage: $0.35/GB-month.
SQLite-based (libSQL), edge-first. Most generous free tier: 5GB storage, 500M row reads/mo, 100 databases. $4.99/mo developer plan.

tasks.task: Store and serve files (images, documents, videos) from your application

best.why: S3-compatible API (use any existing S3 SDK). Zero egress fees — you never pay for downloads. Global CDN included. ~$15/mo for 1TB vs hundreds on S3.

setup.get_api_key: https://dash.cloudflare.com → R2 → Manage R2 API Tokens

code.python:
import boto3
import os

s3 = boto3.client('s3',
    endpoint_url=f'https://{os.environ["R2_ACCOUNT_ID"]}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com',
    aws_access_key_id=os.environ['R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID'],
    aws_secret_access_key=os.environ['R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY']
)

# Upload
s3.upload_file('local_file.png', 'my-bucket', 'uploads/file.png')

# Generate download URL
url = s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object',
    Params={'Bucket': 'my-bucket', 'Key': 'uploads/file.png'},
    ExpiresIn=3600
)
print(url)

best.pricing: Storage: $0.015/GB-month (Infrequent Access: $0.01/GB-month, beta). Class A ops (writes): $4.50/million. Class B ops (reads): $0.36/million. Egress: $0 (always free).
best.free_tier: 10GB storage, 1M Class A ops/mo, 10M Class B ops/mo. Zero egress fees.

alternatives.why: Good if already using Supabase. 1GB free. Integrated auth and row-level security policies.
Industry standard, broadest ecosystem. But has egress fees ($0.09/GB).

tasks.task: Fetch and extract clean content from web pages

best.why: Returns clean markdown — perfect for LLM and agent consumption. Handles JavaScript-rendered pages. Simple REST API. No browser setup required.
best.pricing: Free: 500 credits (one-time). Hobby: $16/mo billed yearly (3K credits). Standard: $83/mo (100K credits). Growth: $333/mo (500K credits). 1 credit = 1 page scrape.
best.free_tier: 500 credits one-time. 2 concurrent requests.

alternatives.why: Free with no API key: just prefix any URL with r.jina.ai/. With API key: 500 RPM, 10M free tokens (~2K pages). ~$0.02/million tokens after that.
Full browser automation, free and open source. More setup required but maximum control.

tasks.task: Add user authentication (login, signup, OAuth) to your application

best.why: Best AI agent integration: has dedicated @clerk/agent-toolkit for Vercel AI SDK, LangChain, and MCP. Curated AI prompts for Cursor/Copilot/Claude. 50K MRUs free (increased from 10K in Feb 2026). Drop-in UI components.
best.pricing: Free: 50,000 MRUs (Monthly Returning Users). Pro: $25/mo (or $20/mo annual) + $0.02/MRU for 50K-100K, tiered down to $0.012 at 10M+. Business: $250-300/mo (SOC2/HIPAA). Enterprise: custom.
best.free_tier: 50,000 MRUs (production-ready). Includes social login, email/password. MFA is Pro-tier. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Free, open source (MIT). Self-hosted. Auth.js/NextAuth team joined Better Auth in Sept 2025. Framework-agnostic (Next.js, Nuxt, SvelteKit, Hono, Express). Plugin-based: email/password, social, 2FA, passkeys, magic links.
Most generous free tier: 50K MAUs free. Cheapest at scale ($0.00325/MAU overage vs Clerk's $0.02). Best if already using Supabase for database.

tasks.warning: Auth.js (NextAuth) v5 never left beta. The core team joined Better Auth in Sept 2025. New projects should use Better Auth or Clerk instead.

tasks.task: Accept payments, subscriptions, or one-time purchases in your application

best.why: Gold-standard API docs — extremely well-structured, interactive examples. Most flexible: one-time, recurring, usage-based, metered billing. Largest ecosystem of integrations.

code.python:
import stripe
import os

stripe.api_key = os.environ['STRIPE_SECRET_KEY']

session = stripe.checkout.Session.create(
    mode='payment',
    line_items=[{
        'price_data': {
            'currency': 'usd',
            'product_data': {'name': 'My Product'},
            'unit_amount': 2000,
        },
        'quantity': 1,
    }],
    success_url='https://example.com/success',
    cancel_url='https://example.com/cancel',
)

print(session.url)

best.pricing: 2.9% + $0.30 per transaction (US cards). No monthly fees. International cards: +1.5%. Stripe Tax, Billing, Radar are additional.
best.free_tier: No monthly fee. Pay per transaction only. Test mode is free.

alternatives.why: Merchant of Record — handles global tax compliance, chargebacks, invoicing. 5% + $0.50 per transaction. No extra international fees. Best for SaaS wanting zero tax work.
Also MoR (owned by Stripe since July 2024). 5% + $0.50 per transaction. Simplest setup for indie hackers. Reports of support degradation since acquisition.

tasks.task: Store and search vector embeddings for AI/RAG applications

best.why: Open source (Apache 2.0), written in Rust. Best price/performance ratio. 60-80% cheaper than Pinecone at scale. 1GB free cloud tier (permanent). Can self-host for free.

code.python:
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
from qdrant_client.models import Distance, VectorParams, PointStruct

client = QdrantClient(url="https://xxx.cloud.qdrant.io", api_key="your-key")

# Create collection
client.create_collection(
    collection_name="my_docs",
    vectors_config=VectorParams(size=1536, distance=Distance.COSINE)
)

# Insert vectors
client.upsert(collection_name="my_docs", points=[
    PointStruct(id=1, vector=[0.1]*1536, payload={"text": "Hello world"}),
    PointStruct(id=2, vector=[0.2]*1536, payload={"text": "Goodbye world"}),
])

# Search
results = client.query_points(
    collection_name="my_docs",
    query=[0.1]*1536,
    limit=5
)
print(results)

best.pricing: Self-hosted: free. Cloud: 1GB free (permanent). Paid: usage-based from ~$25/mo (Managed Cloud) or $0.014/hr (Hybrid Cloud). Available on AWS, GCP, Azure.
best.free_tier: 1GB free cloud tier (no expiry). Self-hosting is completely free.

alternatives.why: Easiest managed setup. Free: 2GB storage, 2M writes/mo, 1M reads/mo. But $50/mo minimum on paid plans (price increased Sept 2025). No self-hosting option.
Easiest to start with — in-memory mode, zero config. Open source (Apache 2.0). Best for prototyping. Migrate away above ~10M vectors.

tasks.task: Add caching or a key-value store to your application

best.why: Only connectionless (HTTP-based) Redis — works everywhere: Lambda, Workers, Edge, WASM. No persistent connections needed. Best free tier among managed Redis options.

setup.get_api_key: https://console.upstash.com → Create database → REST API credentials

code.python:
from upstash_redis import Redis
import os

redis = Redis(
    url=os.environ['UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_URL'],
    token=os.environ['UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_TOKEN']
)

redis.set('user:1', 'Alice')
print(redis.get('user:1'))

best.pricing: Free: 256MB storage, 500K commands/mo, 10 databases. Pay-as-you-go: $0.2/100K commands (no monthly minimum). Fixed plans: from $10/mo. Bandwidth: 200GB free, then $0.03/GB.
best.free_tier: 256MB storage, 500K commands/month, up to 10 databases. Permanent.

alternatives.why: Full Redis feature set (modules, RediSearch, RedisJSON). Requires persistent connections (not ideal for serverless). No permanent free tier — 14-day trial with $500 credit.
Powered by Upstash under the hood. Only useful if already on Vercel. 30K requests/mo on free plan (Hobby, non-commercial only). Use Upstash directly for better pricing.

tasks.task: Add full-text search to your application

best.why: Open source (MIT), written in Rust. Has an official MCP server for AI agent integration. 8.9x cheaper than Algolia. Best typo tolerance out of the box. Easy self-hosting.

code.python:
import meilisearch

client = meilisearch.Client('http://localhost:7700', 'masterKey')

client.index('movies').add_documents([
    {'id': 1, 'title': 'Inception', 'genre': 'Sci-Fi'},
    {'id': 2, 'title': 'Interstellar', 'genre': 'Sci-Fi'},
])

results = client.index('movies').search('incption')
print(results['hits'])

best.pricing: Self-hosted: free (MIT). Cloud: from ~$30/mo (~$59/mo for 250K records + 1M searches).
best.free_tier: Self-hosted: completely free. Cloud: 14-day free trial.

alternatives.why: Best-documented search API. Free (Build): 10K searches/mo, 1M records. Grow: $0.50/1K requests. Most expensive at scale but most features. Startup program: $10K credits.
Open source (GPL v3), written in C++. Cheapest cloud: from ~$7/mo. In-memory architecture = fast queries. GPL license is more restrictive than Meilisearch's MIT.

tasks.task: Send SMS or text messages from your application

best.why: Best documentation in the industry — highly structured API reference, code samples in 7+ languages. Most predictable pricing. Widest ecosystem of integrations.

setup.get_api_key: https://console.twilio.com → Account SID and Auth Token on dashboard

code.python:
from twilio.rest import Client
import os

client = Client(os.environ['TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID'], os.environ['TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN'])

message = client.messages.create(
    body='Hello from agent-need!',
    from_=os.environ['TWILIO_PHONE_NUMBER'],
    to='+1234567890'
)

print(message.sid)

best.pricing: US SMS: $0.0083/msg outbound + carrier surcharges. Phone number: $1.15/mo (local). MMS: $0.022/msg.
best.free_tier: $15.50 trial credit. Limited to verified numbers. Messages prefixed with 'Sent from a Twilio Trial account'.

alternatives.why: Similar pricing (~$0.008/SMS). Messages API supports SMS + WhatsApp + Facebook Messenger in one API. EUR 2 trial credit.

tasks.task: Run background jobs, scheduled tasks, or async workflows

best.why: Serverless, zero-infra. Event-driven workflows with built-in retries, scheduling, sleep (up to 7 days). TypeScript-first with excellent agent-friendly docs. Works with any framework.
best.pricing: Free: 50K executions/mo. Pro: $75/mo (1M executions included, then $50/additional 1M). Enterprise: custom.
best.free_tier: 50K executions/month. 256KB payload. Sleep up to 7 days.

alternatives.why: Open source (Apache 2.0). Best for long-running tasks and AI agent workflows. Free: $5/mo usage included, 10 concurrent runs. Compute: from $0.0000169/sec.
Free, open source. Self-hosted library. Requires your own Redis instance. Full control over infrastructure. Pro: ~$95/mo for advanced features.

tasks.task: Add real-time features (WebSockets, live updates, presence) to your application

best.why: Most generous free tier: 6M messages/month (vs Pusher's 200K/day). No time limit. Excellent interactive docs. Supports pub/sub, presence, chat, and collaborative features.
best.pricing: Free: 6M messages/mo, no credit card. Standard: $29/mo + $2.50/1M messages + $1.00/1M connection-minutes. Pro: $399/mo.
best.free_tier: 6M messages/month. No time limit. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Largest ecosystem, most mature. Free: 200K messages/day, 100 connections. Startup: $49/mo. Note: 1 publish to 50 subscribers = 51 messages counted.
Best if already using Supabase. Included in Supabase plans. Overage: $2.50/1M messages, $10/1K peak connections.

tasks.task: Generate PDF documents programmatically

best.why: HTML/CSS-to-PDF via headless Chrome. Use any web technology to design your PDF, then print to PDF. Most flexible for complex layouts. Free and open source.
best.pricing: Free and open source (Apache 2.0).
best.free_tier: Completely free.

alternatives.why: Declarative JSON-to-PDF. No browser needed. Best for structured documents (invoices, reports). Free, open source.
Python's standard for PDF generation. Full programmatic control. Used by Wikipedia. Free open source version + commercial version.
HTML/CSS-to-PDF without a browser engine. Lighter than Puppeteer. Best for Python projects.

tasks.task: Upload, transform, optimize, and serve images in your application

best.why: Best-in-class documentation with interactive code samples in 10+ languages. URL-based transformations (resize, crop, format conversion via URL parameters). Global CDN included.

code.python:
import cloudinary
import cloudinary.uploader

# Auto-configured from CLOUDINARY_URL env var

result = cloudinary.uploader.upload('local_image.jpg', folder='my-app')
print(result['secure_url'])

# Transform via URL
url = cloudinary.utils.cloudinary_url(result['public_id'],
    width=300, height=300, crop='fill',
    fetch_format='auto', quality='auto'
)[0]
print(url)

best.pricing: Free: 25 credits/mo (1 credit = 1GB storage OR 1GB bandwidth OR 1K transformations). Plus: $89/mo (225 credits). Advanced: $224/mo (600 credits).
best.free_tier: 25 credits/month. No time limit, no credit card required.

alternatives.why: Focused on file uploading UX. Free: 1K operations/mo, 5GB traffic, 1GB storage. SOC2 and HIPAA compliant. Up to 5TB per file on paid plans.
Pure image CDN/optimization via URL parameters. Simple but no permanent free tier (30-day trial only). From ~$62.50/mo.

tasks.task: Track errors, exceptions, and application performance

best.why: Industry standard for error tracking. Extremely comprehensive framework-specific docs with onboarding wizards. Supports every major language and framework.

code.python:
import sentry_sdk
import os

sentry_sdk.init(dsn=os.environ['SENTRY_DSN'])

# Errors are automatically captured
# Manual capture:
try:
    risky_operation()
except Exception as e:
    sentry_sdk.capture_exception(e)

best.pricing: Free (Developer): 5K errors/mo, 5M spans/mo, 50 session replays, 1 user. Team: $26/mo (50K errors, 5M spans). Business: $80/mo (100K errors).
best.free_tier: 5,000 errors/month, 5M spans/month, 50 session replays, 1 user. Forever free.

alternatives.why: Most generous free tier for logs: 500GB/mo data ingestion. From $25/mo paid. Best for log aggregation and serverless observability.
Combines uptime monitoring + logging + incident management. Free: 10 monitors, 1GB logs, 3-day retention. Team: $24/mo.

tasks.task: Route requests between multiple LLM providers with caching, fallbacks, and observability

best.why: Open source (MIT). OpenAI-compatible API across 100+ LLM providers. Single interface for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Mistral, Bedrock, etc. Self-hostable proxy with built-in caching, rate limiting, and spend tracking.

code.python:
from litellm import completion

# Use any model with the same API
response = completion(
    model="anthropic/claude-sonnet-4-20250514",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
)
print(response.choices[0].message.content)

# Switch to OpenAI with same code
response = completion(
    model="gpt-4o",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
)
print(response.choices[0].message.content)
code.proxy_start:
litellm --model anthropic/claude-sonnet-4-20250514 --port 4000
# Then use as OpenAI-compatible endpoint:
# curl http://localhost:4000/v1/chat/completions ...

best.pricing: Free and open source (MIT). Self-hosted. Enterprise: custom.
best.free_tier: Completely free. Self-hosted.

alternatives.why: Managed AI gateway with 50+ pre-built guardrails, prompt management, and detailed analytics. Free tier available.
Unified API for 100+ models. Pay-per-token, no monthly fee. Acts as a marketplace — some models are cheaper through OpenRouter than direct.
One line of code to add caching, rate limiting, and analytics to any LLM API call. Free for Cloudflare users.

tasks.task: Trace, evaluate, and monitor LLM calls in production

best.why: Open source (MIT), 20K+ GitHub stars, 26M+ SDK installs/month. Acquired by ClickHouse (Jan 2026) but remains MIT-licensed and self-hostable. Tracing, evaluations, prompt management, cost tracking. Framework-agnostic.

setup.get_api_key: https://cloud.langfuse.com → Create project → Settings → API Keys

code.python:
from langfuse.openai import openai

# Drop-in replacement for OpenAI — automatically traces all calls
client = openai.OpenAI()

response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4o",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}],
    metadata={"user_id": "user-123"}  # optional metadata
)

print(response.choices[0].message.content)
# Traces automatically appear in Langfuse dashboard

best.pricing: Self-hosted: free (MIT). Cloud: free tier (50K observations/mo). Pro: $59/mo. Team: $119/mo.
best.free_tier: Self-hosted: completely free. Cloud: 50K observations/month.

alternatives.why: Used by Notion, Zapier, Stripe. Strong evaluation and prompt playground features. Logging is free.
Best for LangChain/LangGraph users. Tight integration with LangChain ecosystem. Free: 5K traces/mo.

tasks.task: Add persistent memory to AI agents across sessions

best.why: Developer-first memory layer for AI agents. Vendor-agnostic — works with OpenAI, Anthropic, LangGraph, CrewAI, Vercel AI SDK. YC-backed, 50K+ developers. Stores and retrieves relevant memories automatically.

code.python:
from mem0 import Memory

m = Memory()

# Add memories
m.add("I prefer dark mode and Python over JavaScript", user_id="alice")
m.add("My project uses Next.js with Supabase", user_id="alice")

# Search relevant memories
results = m.search("What tech stack does the user prefer?", user_id="alice")
for r in results:
    print(r['memory'])

best.pricing: Free: 10K memories, 1K retrieval calls/mo. Paid: usage-based beyond free tier.
best.free_tier: 10,000 memories, 1,000 retrieval calls/month.

alternatives.why: Temporal knowledge graph — tracks how facts change over time. Stronger for complex entity relationships and contradiction detection.
Agent runtime with self-editing memory. Agents can autonomously decide what to remember and forget.

tasks.task: Send push notifications and multi-channel alerts (push, in-app, email, SMS)

best.why: Open source notification infrastructure. Unified API for push, email, SMS, in-app, and chat. Integrates with existing providers (Twilio, Resend, FCM). Visual workflow editor for notification logic.
best.pricing: Free: 10K workflow runs/mo. Pro: from $30/mo ($1.20/1K extra runs). Team: from $250/mo. Self-hosted: free (open source).
best.free_tier: 10,000 workflow runs/month. All channels. 20 workflows. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Best for mobile push. Free: unlimited mobile push sends, 10K web push subscribers. Used by Uber, Adobe. SDKs for iOS, Android, web, React Native.
Notification orchestration with advanced workflows (delays, batching, throttling). Free: 10K messages/mo.

tasks.task: Add product analytics, event tracking, and user behavior insights to your application

best.why: Open source, all-in-one: product analytics, web analytics, session replay, feature flags, experiments, surveys, LLM analytics. Self-hostable. Most generous free tier in the category.
best.pricing: Free: 1M events/mo, 5K session replays, unlimited feature flags. Paid: usage-based ($0.00031/event beyond 1M).
best.free_tier: 1M events/month, 5K session replays, unlimited feature flags and experiments. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Privacy-focused, cookie-free web analytics. Lightweight (<1KB script). EU-hosted. From $9/mo. Open source (AGPL).
Best for funnel and retention analysis. Free: 1M events/mo (reduced from 20M in late 2025). Most powerful query builder for behavioral analytics.

tasks.task: Deploy a web application to production

best.why: Best DX for frontend and Next.js apps. Git push to deploy. Global CDN, serverless functions, edge compute. Generous free tier for personal projects.

code.cli:
# Deploy from project directory
vercel

# Deploy to production
vercel --prod

# Or just push to GitHub with Vercel integration — auto-deploys on every push
code.env_setup:
# Set environment variables
vercel env add SUPABASE_URL production
vercel env add STRIPE_SECRET_KEY production

best.pricing: Hobby: free (personal, non-commercial). Pro: $20/user/mo (1TB bandwidth). Enterprise: custom.
best.free_tier: Hobby: 100GB bandwidth, 6K build minutes, serverless functions. Personal non-commercial use only.

alternatives.why: Open source self-hosted PaaS — Vercel/Heroku alternative on your own server. 44K+ GitHub stars. All features free. One-line install. 280+ one-click service deployments. Dramatically cheaper at scale (~$14/mo vs $850/mo on Vercel for equivalent setups).
Simple PaaS for full-stack apps, databases, and background workers. Usage-based billing. No permanent free tier — Hobby: $5/mo with $5 credit included.

tasks.warning: Vercel Hobby plan is for personal non-commercial use only. For business use, you need Pro ($20/user/mo). Fly.io no longer has a meaningful free tier for new accounts (2-hour trial only).

tasks.task: Set up a type-safe database access layer (ORM) for a TypeScript/JavaScript project

best.why: SQL-first, ~7.4KB bundle, zero dependencies. Type-safe without code generation. Works on serverless/edge from day one (Node, Bun, Deno, Workers). Supports Postgres, MySQL, SQLite, and serverless DBs (Neon, Turso, D1, Supabase).

setup.install: npm install drizzle-orm postgres && npm install -D drizzle-kit

code.migration:
# Generate migration
npx drizzle-kit generate

# Apply migration
npx drizzle-kit migrate

best.pricing: Free and open source (Apache 2.0).
best.free_tier: Completely free.

alternatives.why: Schema-first ORM. Prisma 7 (2026) removed Rust engine — now TypeScript/WASM, 90% smaller bundle (1.6MB vs 14MB), up to 3.4x faster. Best docs in the ORM space. Supports MongoDB. Code generation required.

tasks.warning: Drizzle is best for new projects. Prisma 7 is a major improvement — if your project already uses Prisma, upgrading to v7 is worthwhile rather than migrating to Drizzle.

tasks.task: Convert text to natural-sounding speech audio

best.why: Most natural-sounding voices in the industry. 30+ languages. Voice cloning, custom voices. Streaming support for real-time applications. Python and Node SDKs.

code.python:
from elevenlabs import ElevenLabs

client = ElevenLabs()

audio = client.text_to_speech.convert(
    text="Hello! Welcome to agent-need.",
    voice_id="JBFqnCBsd6RMkjVDRZzb",  # George voice
    model_id="eleven_turbo_v2_5"
)

with open("output.mp3", "wb") as f:
    for chunk in audio:
        f.write(chunk)

best.pricing: Free: 10K credits/mo (~20 min). Starter: $5/mo (~30 min). Creator: $22/mo. Pro: $99/mo. Business: ~$1,100/mo. Credit rollover up to 2 months.
best.free_tier: 10,000 credits/month (~20 minutes of audio). Non-commercial only. 3 custom voices. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Simple API, good quality. tts-1: $15/1M chars. tts-1-hd: $30/1M chars. 6 built-in voices. No voice cloning.
Fastest TTS API — optimized for real-time conversational AI. $0.0135/1K chars. Best for voice agents and chatbots.

tasks.task: Add feature flags, A/B testing, and safe rollouts to your application

best.why: All-in-one: feature flags + experiments + analytics in one tool. Open source. Unlimited feature flags on free tier. No separate tool needed — flags are automatically linked to analytics data.

code.python:
from posthog import Posthog

posthog = Posthog(project_api_key='phc_xxx', host='https://us.i.posthog.com')

if posthog.feature_enabled('new-checkout-flow', 'user-123'):
    # Show new checkout
    pass
else:
    # Show old checkout
    pass

best.pricing: Feature flags: free and unlimited (all plans). Experiments: free for first 1M events/mo.
best.free_tier: Unlimited feature flags. 1M events/month for experiments. No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Used by OpenAI, Notion, Figma, Atlassian. Combines feature flags + experimentation + product analytics. Free tier available.
Open source (MIT), data warehouse-native. Best for teams that want feature flags connected directly to their analytics data warehouse.
